greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of compositions of n such that every part occurs with the same multiplicity.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1300
maple: a:= n-> `if`(n=0, 1, add((p-> add(coeff(p, x, i)*(i*m)!/(m!)^i,
mathematica: b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n>i*(i+1)/2, 0, If[n == 0, 1, Expand[b[n, i-1] + If[i>n, 0, b[n-i, i-1]*x]]]]; a[n_] := If[n == 0, 1, Sum[Function[p, Sum[Coefficient[p, x, i]*(i*m)!/m!^i, {i, 0, Exponent[p, x]}]][b[n/m, n/m]], {m, Divisors[n]}]]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 70}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 21 2016, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Oct 26 2004
